content.question: A random sample of 500 adults living in a large county was selected and 304 adults from the sample indicated that the unemployment rate was of great concern. What is the standard error of the sample proportion <math alttext="p hat" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction 0.61 times 0.39 over 500" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.61</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.39</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>500</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction 0.61 times 0.39 over 304" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.61</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.39</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>304</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction 304 times 196 over 500" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>304</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>196</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>500</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 0.304 times 0.196 over the square root of 500" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.304</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.196</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>500</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 0.61 times 0.39 over the square root of 500" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.61</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.39</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>500</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction 0.61 times 0.39 over 500" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.61</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.39</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>500</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.2: Constructing a Confidence Interval for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
